name: cyclohexanol, 4-chloro-, trans-
Reason: The compound cyclohexanol, 4-chloro-, trans- has a melting point of 5.5°C due to the presence of a benzene ring. The chlorine atom attached to the benzene ring can increase the melting point by approximately +50°C due to its electronegative nature and the increased intermolecular interactions it participates in. The cyclohexyl group, which is rigid and planar, can also contribute to an increase in melting point due to its participation in hydrogen bonding, estimated to be around +30°C. The trans-isomer has a higher melting point than the cis-isomer due to the increased steric hindrance and rigidity of the molecule.
